chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Edward Nathan Hernandez was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Rock County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.

timeConds.notes: Jail time imposed; to be served at the discretion of the OWI Court.  Huber granted, 14 hours per day.  Defendant required to contact the diversion office at (608) 373-3880 within 3 days.

records.addlTxt: OWI Court Contract

09:52 AM Defendant Edward Nathan Hernandez in court with attorney Kelly J. Freeman.  Mason C Braunschweig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads guilty to Count 2; Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 1 and 3 are dismissed and read in.  Defendant waives right to presentence investigation. Court orders sentence withheld, 2 years probation, $600 fine plus costs due to Clerk of Court, 45 days Rock County Jail to be served at the discretion of the OWI court staff, 2 years drivers licence revoked, 2 years ignition interlock device, any treatment deemed necessary, 0 days sentence credit.  Defendant remanded to OWI Court. Probation review hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
